page.title: 10 Ditchingham Village Hall 1
page.content: Ditchingham Village Hall, Loddon Road, replaces a hut erected in 1920 and stands on a part of the heath donated by the Carr Estate. It is 25 metres long by 12 metres wide with a frontage of 37.5 metres, including adequate parking space front and back. In 1975 a committee of dedicated villagers proposed replacing the hut with a structure that would serve the needs of every section of the community. Grants of 50% from the Department of Education and Science and 25% from Norfolk County Council were available on condition that the village found the rest. By 1980, owing to inflation and more ambitious plans, Ditchingham's original target had doubled to Â£15,000. In 1981, when the building was opened, the village contd. on page 11
